title: Group of 101 farmers to resume Delhi march from Shambhu border on Jan 21: Sarwan Singh Pandher
desc: A group of 101 farmers will resume their march to Delhi on January 21 to demand a legal guarantee for minimum support prices for crops. This move follows several unsuccessful attempts and comes as 111 farmers have started a fast-unto-death in Haryana. The central government has not agreed to the farmers' demands despite ongoing protests.

title: Congress to embark on 'Kisan Mazdoor Samman Evam Nyay Yatra' in UP from February
desc: The Congress has postponed its 'Kisan Mazdoor Samman Evam Nyay Yatra' in Uttar Pradesh to avoid clashing with the Maha Kumbh, planning to start next month. The yatra aims to address the grievances of farmers, including payment issues and lack of compensation for land acquisition, with statewide involvement of 300 'Kisan Nyay Yoddhas' in each district.

title: Deadlock continues as 111 farmers sit on fast-unto-death in solidarity with Jagjit Singh Dallewal
desc: A group of 111 farmers began a fast-unto-death in solidarity with Jagjit Singh Dallewal, whose indefinite hunger strike has lasted 51 days. Protesting for a legally guaranteed minimum support price (MSP) for crops, the farmers criticize the Centre for ignoring their demands, risking Dallewal's deteriorating health.

title: India prioritises farmers' issues, assures support: EAM S Jaishankar
desc: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reassured that India's government is committed to addressing farmers' issues, despite complexities and politicization. He emphasized efforts such as increasing the Minimum Support Price (MSP) rate. The statement follows a hunger strike by farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, urging the government to fulfill promises made during the 2021 agitation.

title: Rs 80 lakh from milk: Meet the two women from Karnataka and Kerala who got best dairy farmer awards
desc: Mangalamma, a 47-year-old dairy farmer from Dinka village in Mandya district, earned Rs 30 lakh by selling cow milk. She was recognized as the Best Dairy Farmer of Karnataka at the Southern Dairy Summit-2025. Vidhu Rajeev from Kerala was also honored for her dairy farming success. Both farmers' achievements highlight the importance of scientific management in dairy farming.

title: Karnataka: Kumaraswamy questions Govt over delay in compensating NICE land losers
desc: Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy criticized the Karnataka government for delaying compensation to farmers whose lands were acquired for the BMIC project despite Supreme Court orders. He accused officials and Congress leaders of colluding to exploit farmers and urged the government to take immediate action.

title: Farmer attempts suicide at Shambhu border, dies at Patiala hospital
desc: A 55-year-old farmer at the Shambhu border between Punjab and Haryana, protesting for almost a year for MSP guarantees, committed suicide by consuming poison. This incident marks the second suicide at the site in three weeks. Another farmer previously ended his life, distressed over an unresolved farmer leader's health condition.

title: Low GDP forecast means govt can't deny slowdown: Congress
desc: Congress has criticized the government's handling of the economy, highlighting a low GDP forecast for FY25. It has called for radical actions in the upcoming budget to address the growth slowdown and investment issues. They emphasized the need for income support for the poor, higher wages, increased MSPs, and simplification of the GST regime.

title: Centre ready for talks, farmers shouldn't set conditions: Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar
desc: Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar urged farmers to engage in unconditional talks with the central government amid ongoing protests. He criticized farmers for not cooperating with the Supreme Court committee. Meanwhile, Arvind Kejriwal accused the BJP of reneging on promises made to farmers three years ago.

title: Fitting reply to Opposition: Telangana Minister Jupally Krishna Rao after govt increases Rythu Bharosa cash handout
desc: Telangana Minister Jupally Krishna Rao announces increased benefits for farmers under the Rythu Bharosa scheme, providing Rs 12,000 per acre annually. Additionally, landless families and agricultural laborers will receive similar benefits under the Indiramma Atmeeya Bharosa scheme. These initiatives aim to counter opposition criticism and support farmers starting January 26, 2025.

title: Why can't Centre say it will consider genuine grievances of farmers? SC asks
desc: The Supreme Court asked the Centre to consider the farmers' grievances and be open to dialogues, regarding their demands including the legal guarantee of MSP for crops. The court has also issued a notice to the Centre and the high-powered committee for their responses to the petition within 10 days.

title: Farmers' Protests: Jagjit Singh Dallewal to take medical aid if Centre agrees to talk, Punjab tells SC
desc: The Punjab government sought additional time from the Supreme Court to comply with orders for hospitalizing farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, on a fast for over a month. Dallewal has agreed to accept medical aid if the Centre agrees to hold talks. The court granted the request, scheduling a compliance review for January 2, 2025.

title: CPI(M) demands govt immediately start talks with farmer groups
desc: Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal continues his indefinite hunger strike since November 26, demanding legal guarantee for MSP and farm loan waivers. The CPI(M) urges the government to promptly engage in talks with farmer organisations as Dallewal's health deteriorates. The Supreme Court gives the Punjab government until December 31 to persuade him to move to a hospital.

title: Akhilesh Yadav accuses BJP of ignoring farmers' issues amid Sambhal excavation
desc: Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of using an archaeological find in Sambhal to distract from farmers' struggles. Farmers continue their protest at the Punjab-Haryana border for MSP guarantee. Yadav highlighted the unavailability of fertilizers and rising prices impacting farmers. A stepwell was discovered in Sambhal during an excavation.

title: Maharashtra legislature session wasted as ministers sans portfolios kept mum: Oppn
desc: Maharashtra's opposition parties criticized the recent legislative session as a mere formality, alleging the government's inability to address critical issues due to unallocated portfolios. They highlighted concerns over farmer distress, escalating violence, and a lack of concrete solutions, accusing the government of inaction and prioritizing select businessmen over public welfare.

title: Remove 20 per cent export duty on onions: Ajit Pawar to Centre
desc: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister, has written to the Union Commerce Minister. Pawar seeks removal of the 20% export duty on onions. Nashik onion farmers face distress due to low prices. The current rate is around Rs 2,400 per quintal. Unseasonal rains and climate change have impacted earnings. The export duty makes Maharashtra onions less competitive globally.

title: Govt will not remove temples built on Waqf properties, CM Siddaramaiah tells Assembly
desc: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah promised no temple demolition on Waqf land. Eviction notices will be withdrawn. BJP raised the Waqf issue in the Assembly. Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan confirmed notice withdrawals for farmers and temples. BJP demanded removal of Waqf property mentions from records. Siddaramaiah highlighted the reduction of Waqf properties. BJP staged a walkout, unsatisfied with the government's response.

title: Sharad Pawar meets PM Modi along with two farmers from Maharashtra
desc: NCP-SP chief Sharad Pawar met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Parliament, presenting him with pomegranates from Maharashtra farmers. Weeks prior, the BJP-led alliance decisively defeated Pawar's MVA in the state assembly elections. Although Pawar recently invited Modi to inaugurate a literary event, the topic wasn't discussed during their meeting.

title: If talks happen, they will be with central government: Sarwan Singh Pandher after farmers reject SC committee
desc: Farmers protesting at the Khanauri border rejected a Supreme Court-appointed committee, insisting on talks with the central government. Sarwan Singh Pandher, representing the protesting farmers, stated the committee failed to address issues promptly. Simultaneously, Jagjit Singh Dallewal, on hunger strike for 22 days, criticized the committee's delayed response and confirmed future discussions would be held solely with the central government.

title: Cong promoted water disputes between states, does little for farmers: PM Modi
desc: Prime Minister Modi criticized Congress for delaying the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project, accusing them of hindering farmers' progress. He highlighted the BJP's collaborative approach to water management, contrasting it with Congress's promotion of interstate water disputes. Modi also praised the Rajasthan BJP government's achievements in its first year.

title: Emergency-like situation: Vinesh Phogat calls for nationwide participation in farmers' protest
desc: Vinesh Phogat joined farmers protesting at the Khanauri border. Farmers and leaders are demanding minimum support prices for crops. DGP Gaurav Yadav met with farmer leaders. He urged medical assistance for Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a hunger strike. The Supreme Court asked for Dallewal's well-being. The protest continues with farmers demanding action.

title: Farmers pleading for justice because Modi govt 'betrayed' them again and again: Kharge
desc: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly betraying farmers. Kharge highlighted unfulfilled promises on income, MSP, and fertilizer shortages. He condemned the government's forceful response to farmers' protests, including tear gas and barricades at the Delhi border. Kharge urged the government to address farmers' concerns and respect their right to protest.

title: Farmers unhappy with both INDIA bloc and BJP, says Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher
desc: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher criticized PM Modi's visit to Haryana on Monday, questioning whether the PM would claim his party's election victories as evidence of the success of his development approach. Pandher emphasized that farmers remain dissatisfied with both the ruling BJP and the opposition INDIA alliance, urging Modi to address their concerns and take action on the ongoing farmers' protest.

title: Congress slams government for tear-gassing farmers
desc: Congress criticized the central and Haryana governments for using tear gas on protesting farmers at the Shambhu border. Farmers were marching to Delhi to demand guaranteed minimum support prices (MSP), a promise Congress alleges the BJP government broke after over 700 farmer deaths during previous protests. Congress accused the BJP of favoring capitalists while denying fair prices to farmers and escalating farming costs.

title: Third Eye: Hunger strike by farmers, hoax bomb threats, and slowdown in Kota industry
desc: Farmers in Greater Noida jail launched a hunger strike for land rights. A hoax bomb threat targeted Lucknow's major transit hubs. Kota's coaching industry faces a downturn due to student suicides, new regulations, and market expansion, impacting student numbers and revenue.

title: Modi govt in no mood for talks, 101 farmers to march towards Delhi on Sunday: Pandher
desc: Farmers protesting at the Punjab-Haryana border plan to resume their march to Delhi on December 8 after being stopped by tear gas on Friday. They demand talks with the Centre on issues including MSP and debt waiver, alleging the government is unwilling to negotiate. One farmer leader continues a hunger strike, while others claim injuries from the police response.

title: 'Farmers' demands are related to Centre, not state': Punjab Minister on 'Dilli Chalo' protest march
desc: Punjab Minister Baljit Kaur criticized the Union Government for the ongoing farmers' 'Dilli Chalo' protest, stating that the farmers' demands are directed at the Centre, not the state. Farmers in Punjab are protesting at Sambhu border, demanding compensation and a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP).

title: Farmers' protests received huge booster dose from no less than Vice President: Congress
desc: Farmers marched towards Delhi, demanding legal guarantee for MSP and other key issues. Congress backed the protests, highlighting Vice President Dhankhar's recent remarks questioning the government's fulfillment of promises made to farmers. Heavy security presence met the farmers at the Haryana border.

title: Congress rakes up Jagdeep Dhankhar’s remarks to raise farmers’ protest issue in Rajya Sabha
desc: Opposition members in the Rajya Sabha protested against the government's handling of farmer demands, citing Chairman Dhankhar's recent remarks on the issue. They shouted slogans, staged a walkout, and demanded action on Minimum Support Price (MSP) guarantees. Dhankhar criticized the Opposition's timing, claiming their concern was disingenuous. The House eventually resumed normal function.
